course_description: An introductory course covering fundamental concepts of computer science including algorithms, data structures, and programming principles.
A comprehensive study of data structures and algorithms, including sorting algorithms, trees, graphs, and dynamic programming.
An in-depth exploration of computer networking principles, protocols, and technologies such as TCP/IP, Ethernet, and wireless networks.
Study of database design, implementation, and management, covering relational databases, SQL, and database administration.
An examination of operating system principles, including process management, memory management, file systems, and virtualization.
A study of software development methodologies, requirements engineering, design principles, and software testing.
An exploration of computer architecture principles including instruction set architecture, pipelining, and memory hierarchy.
Introduction to AI techniques including search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning, and natural language processing.
Study of cybersecurity concepts, cryptography, network security, and ethical hacking techniques.
A practical course covering web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and server-side scripting languages.
Introduction to computer graphics algorithms, rendering techniques, and 3D modeling.
Study of embedded system design, microcontroller programming, real-time operating systems, and interfacing.
